meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dedicated to a cause or activity.
meanings.sent1: Her commitment to helping others is truly inspiring.
meanings.sent2: His commitment to his job is unwavering.
meanings.sent3: She showed her commitment to recycling by carrying a reusable water bottle everywhere.
meanings.sent4: His commitment to excellence is like a shining beacon in the workplace.
meanings.sent5: The commitment of the volunteers made a real difference in the community.

meanings.definition: An agreement or pledge to do something in the future.
meanings.sent1: Their commitment to meet every week for coffee kept their friendship strong.
meanings.sent2: I made a commitment to finish reading the book by the end of the month.
meanings.sent3: His commitment to always bring snacks to movie night was greatly appreciated.
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to be on time is as solid as a rock.
meanings.sent5: The commitment to donate a portion of sales to charity was well received by customers.

meanings.definition: The act of officially sending someone to a prison or mental hospital.
meanings.sent1: The judge's commitment of the criminal brought closure to the victims.
meanings.sent2: The commitment of the dangerous individual was necessary for public safety.
meanings.sent3: The commitment of the suspect to the mental hospital was a relief to the community.
meanings.sent4: The commitment of the patient to the psychiatric facility was a step towards healing.
meanings.sent5: The commitment of the prisoner to serve their sentence showed remorse.
